bill.title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to discontinue certain administrative cost allowances, and for other purposes.
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 54 (Tuesday, March 28, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. RUSSELL:H.R. 1767.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H2517]

item.title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to discontinue certain administrative cost allowances, and for other purposes.
To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to discontinue certain administrative cost allowances, and for other purposes.

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text: This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to eliminate payments to institutions of higher education to defray the costs of administering the Federal Pell Grant program.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
